public_transport_tips.tip: Budapest‚Äôs metro, tram, and bus network is extensive ‚Äî get a 24-hour or 72-hour travel card for unlimited rides.

cities.name: Szeged

Art & Culture.name: Votive Church of Szeged (Dom)
Art & Culture.description: A magnificent red-brick cathedral built after the great flood of 1879 ‚Äî climb the tower for stunning views over Szeged.

Art & Culture.name: M√≥ra Ferenc Museum

cities.local_food_tip: Try 'Szegedi hal√°szl√©' (fish soup with paprika), one of Hungary‚Äôs national dishes. Don‚Äôt miss 't√∫r√≥s csusza' (pasta with cottage cheese and bacon) and a slice of 'Szegedi dobostorta' for dessert!

public_transport_tips.tip: Szeged‚Äôs tram and trolleybus network is clean and reliable ‚Äî tickets are available at kiosks or from machines.
Trains connect Szeged with Budapest every hour, taking about 2 hours ‚Äî easy for a day trip or weekend getaway.
The city center is flat and compact, ideal for exploring on foot or by rented bike.

city_events.description: Szeged Open-Air Festival ‚Äî Hungary‚Äôs most famous outdoor theater and music festival at D√≥m Square.
Szeged Wine Festival ‚Äî local winemakers and artisans fill the streets with music and flavor.
Szeged Christmas Market ‚Äî festive lights, hot drinks, and handmade gifts around Sz√©chenyi Square.
